Subjective: Left eye irritation started Tuesday morning on waking. Feels like a hair or dust (foreign body sensation). Progressed to increased redness and swelling ("thicker"). Right eye became red starting yesterday. Eyes stuck together in the morning. Pain only on squeezing eyes shut hard. No change in vision, no photophobia, no significant resting pain. No known trauma, no new cosmetics (mascara, cream). No systemic illness, no fever. First time eye issue. Social: Lives with young daughter (Isa); boyfriend currently away. Concern: Worried it is something serious, contagious to daughter. Request: Confirmation of diagnosis, asks if antibiotics or drops are needed.
Objective: Eyes: Bilateral conjunctival injection. Redness visible. No foreign body seen on lower or upper lid eversion. Eyelashes appear normal. Pupils are equal and reactive to light bilaterally.
Plan: Reassurance: Explained as likely viral inflammation that will resolve on its own, typically within 2 weeks.
Symptomatic Care: May use OTC artificial tears for soothing/irritation.
Advice: Do not rub eyes. May clean stuck eyelids in the morning with lukewarm tap water and a cotton pad.
Safety Netting: Return immediately for increased pain, significant pus/discharge, or any vision changes.
Follow-up: Return in 2 weeks if symptoms have not resolved.
